Nightbitch is an upcoming American comedy horror film written and directed by Marielle Heller. It is based on the 2021 novel of the same name by Rachel Yoder.[1] The film stars Amy Adams, Scoot McNairy, and Zoe Chao.
Nightbitch is scheduled to be released in the United States by Searchlight Pictures on December 6, 2024.


Premise[edit]
A stay-at-home mom decides to break her boring cycle and starts to believe that she is turning into a dog at night.[citation needed]

Production[edit]
Development[edit]
In July 2020, Annapurna Pictures acquired the film rights to the then-unpublished Nightbitch, written by Rachel Yoder, with Amy Adams attached to star and produce.[3] Stacy O'Neil of Adams' Bond Group Entertainment production company will co-produce the film alongside Megan Ellison, Sue Naegle and Sammy Scher, while Yoder would serve as executive producer.[4] Can You Ever Forgive Me? filmmaker Marielle Heller connected with Yoder's novel and began to quietly develop the film alongside Adams during the COVID-19 pandemic.[5]

Pre-production[edit]
In March 2022, filming was scheduled to begin in the fall of that year.[6] In May, Searchlight Pictures acquired distribution rights from Annapurna for $25 million, winning out from five other bidders.[7] At this time, Heller's involvement was officially confirmed. Christina Oh, Adam Paulsen, and Heller had boarded the film as producers, while Scher moved to executive producer with Havilah Brewster.[8] On June 27, 2022, Scoot McNairy joined the film.[9][10]

Filming[edit]
Production was intended to begin in September 2022 in Los Angeles.[11] It began in October 2022, with the announcement that Ella Thomas[12] and Garret Phillips had joined the cast.[13][14] On October 21, 2022, Mary Holland joined the cast.[15]

Release[edit]
Nightbitch was originally set to be released on Hulu,[16][17] but was later announced for a theatrical release by Searchlight Pictures for December 6, 2024.[18]
